verses.text: David and the commanders of the army set apart for service the sons of Asaph, Heman, and Jeduthun, who prophesied with lyres, harps, and cymbals. Here is their list for the service:
verses.comment: This verse introduces the musical duties; 'prophesied' here means worship with music as guided by the Spirit.

verses.text: Of the sons of Asaph: Zaccur, Joseph, Nethaniah, and Asharelah—the sons of Asaph, under the authority of Asaph, who prophesied under the king's direction.
verses.comment: Names are sometimes transliterated differently; Asharelah is sometimes Asarelah or Jesharelah.

verses.text: Of Jeduthun: the sons of Jeduthun—Gedaliah, Zeri, Jeshaiah, Shimei, Hashabiah, and Mattithiah, six, under their father Jeduthun, who prophesied with the harp, giving thanks and praise to the Lord.
verses.comment: Some manuscripts list Zeri as Izri. Their role included musical prophecy, especially praise.

verses.text: Of Heman: the sons of Heman—Bukkiah, Mattaniah, Uzziel, Shubael, Jerimoth, Hananiah, Hanani, Eliathah, Giddalti, Romamti-Ezer, Joshbekashah, Mallothi, Hothir, and Mahazioth.
verses.comment: Lists 14 sons of Heman; names may have variant spellings in different sources.

verses.text: All these were sons of Heman, the king's seer, and Heman gave him fourteen sons and three daughters, for God had promised to exalt him.
verses.comment: Heman is called the king's seer (prophet); God blessed him with many children.

verses.text: They were all under the direction of their fathers for the music in the house of the Lord, with cymbals, harps, and lyres, for the service of the house of God. Asaph, Jeduthun, and Heman were under the king's orders.
verses.comment: Emphasizes the musical worship directed by family heads and the king.

verses.text: Their number, along with their relatives who were trained in singing to the Lord—all who were skilled—was two hundred eighty-eight.
verses.comment: Clear count: 288 skilled musicians and singers.

verses.text: They cast lots for their duties, whether small or great, teacher or student.
verses.comment: 'Teacher or student' translates 'master or apprentice,' showing impartiality.

verses.text: The first lot fell to Asaph, to Joseph; the second, to Gedaliah—his relatives and sons were twelve;
verses.comment: Each division has 12 assigned musicians. Joseph and Gedaliah are heads for their groups.

verses.text: the third, to Zaccur, his sons and relatives, twelve;
the fourth, to Izri, his sons and relatives, twelve;
verses.comment: Izri is also called Zeri in some versions.

verses.text: the fifth, to Nethaniah, his sons and relatives, twelve;
the sixth, to Bukkiah, his sons and relatives, twelve;
the seventh, to Jesharelah, his sons and relatives, twelve;
verses.comment: Also rendered Asharelah in other translations.

verses.text: the eighth, to Jeshaiah, his sons and relatives, twelve;
the ninth, to Mattaniah, his sons and relatives, twelve;
the tenth, to Shimei, his sons and relatives, twelve;
verses.comment: Shimei is counted in some lists; his group is assigned here.

verses.text: the eleventh, to Azarel, his sons and relatives, twelve;
verses.comment: Azarel also spelled as Uzziel elsewhere.

verses.text: the twelfth, to Hashabiah, his sons and relatives, twelve;
the thirteenth, to Shubael, his sons and relatives, twelve;
verses.comment: Shubael sometimes appears as Shebuel in other places.

verses.text: the fourteenth, to Mattithiah, his sons and relatives, twelve;
the fifteenth, to Jerimoth, his sons and relatives, twelve;
the sixteenth, to Hananiah, his sons and relatives, twelve;
the seventeenth, to Joshbekashah, his sons and relatives, twelve;
the eighteenth, to Hanani, his sons and relatives, twelve;
the nineteenth, to Mallothi, his sons and relatives, twelve;
the twentieth, to Eliathah, his sons and relatives, twelve;
the twenty-first, to Hothir, his sons and relatives, twelve;
the twenty-second, to Giddalti, his sons and relatives, twelve;
the twenty-third, to Mahazioth, his sons and relatives, twelve;
the twenty-fourth, to Romamti-Ezer, his sons and relatives, twelve.
verses.comment: Each of the twenty-four divisions has twelve members, totaling 288 (v.7).
